page.title: 17Bank and Gritnam
page.content: The village of Bank is very small and consists of very few houses. In total there are 19 houses, 1 Public House and a large mansion which has been made into 10 flats. The house is called Amsley House. The rest of the houses are quite large and there are also some cottages. The houses in both Bank and Gritnam originate from the 16th to 17th century. The hamlet of Gritnam lies about \ km south of Bank along a narrow track. The hamlet opens onto the forest and there are 6 cottages. All the people have lived in the forest all their lives. They all work in the forest and surrounding areas. There are no shops or amenities of any kind for a couple of miles. All of the houses have very large gardens which are used mainly for growing vegetables.
